Definition: You will be given a sentence pair from Wikipedia that have high lexical overlap. If the sentences have the same meaning and are just paraphrases of each other, label them as "Paraphrase". If not, label them as "Not paraphrase". The two sentences are seperated by a new line.

Positive Examples.input:
In January 2011 , the Deputy Secretary General of FIBA Asia , Hagop Khajirian , inspected the venue together with SBP - President Manuel V. Pangilinan .
In January 2011 , FIBA Asia deputy secretary general Hagop Khajirian along with SBP president Manuel V. Pangilinan inspected the venue .
Positive Examples.explanation: The second sentence has the same meaning as the first sentence and is just a paraphrased version of it.

Positive Examples.input:
The smallest number that can be represented in two positive and seventh ways as a sum of four different powers is 2056364173794800 .
The smallest number that can be represented as a sum of four positive seventh potences in two different ways is 2056364173794800 .
Positive Examples.explanation: The second sentence doesn't have the same meaning as the first.

Positive Examples.input:
Luciano Williames Dias ( born July 25 , 1970 ) is a Brazilian football coach and former player .
Luciano Williames Dias ( born 25 July 1970 ) is a former football coach and Brazilian player .
Positive Examples.explanation: The second sentence doesn't have the same meaning as the first.

Positive Examples.input:
During her sophomore , junior and senior summers , she spent half of it with her Alaska team , and half playing , and living in Oregon .
During her second , junior and senior summers , she spent half of it with her Alaska team , half playing and living in Oregon .
Positive Examples.explanation: The second sentence doesn't have the same meaning as the first.

Negative Examples.input:
This was a series of nested angular standards , so that measurements in azimuth and elevation could be done directly in polar coordinates relative to the ecliptic .
This was a series of nested polar scales , so that measurements in azimuth and elevation could be performed directly in angular coordinates relative to the ecliptic .
Negative Examples.explanation: The second sentence doesn't have the same meaning as the first. As pointed out in the task definition both sentences in all the instances have high lexical overlap, which doesn't mean they have the same meaning.

Negative Examples.input:
His father emigrated to Missouri in 1868 but returned when his wife became ill and before the rest of the family could also go to America .
His father emigrated to America in 1868 , but returned when his wife became ill and before the rest of the family could go to Missouri .
Negative Examples.explanation: In the second sentence, it is not mentioned that the father went to Missouri, so the part about the rest of the family doesn't imply the same meaning as the first sentence. These are not paraphrases.

Instances.input:
No farthings were produced during the second reigns of Henry VI and Edward IV , or during the brief reign of Edward V .
During the brief reign of Henry VI and Eduard IV , or during the second reign of Edward V , no farthings were produced .

Particularly strong erosion occurred in warmer melting periods during the ice ages , when tundra climate reigned and the soil was not protected by a dense cover of vegetation .
Particularly dense erosion occurred in warmer melting periods during the ice ages , when the climate of the tundra prevailed and the soil was not protected by a strong vegetation .

Guru Arjan Dev has also said that Bhagat Beni attained enlightenment only through the Holy Word .
Guru Arjan Dev also said that Bhagat Beni has only achieved enlightenment through the Holy Word .
